comrades

What is Comrades?

Comrades is an AngularJS web application that matches users with the communist heroes of their dreams. The project was bootstrapped with Yeoman's Angular generator and uses Angular's MVW framework to render locally hosted JSON data in an attractive, speedy manner. Angular-Route.js increases application efficiency by generating views without page reloads.

Bootstrap-SASS handles the CSS3 (with animations sprinkled in), and controller-side calculations to determine comrade match strength are all done via functional JavaScript programming. The app is hosted via Heroku and available on GitHub.If you have any feedback on the project, send us a pull request on GitHub or shoot us an email.

Meet Matt

Matt Thrasher is a Minneapolis-based front-end web developer with two-threee years experience in HTML5/CSS3/Javascript/AngularJS and Ruby on Rails. He has a bachelor's degree in Russian Studies from Macalester College, and this spring, he will have an associate's in Computer Science from North Hennepin Community College. In his free time, Matt enjoys basketball, Mexican food, history, cocktails, playing guitar, and chatting with his favorite communist theorists on Comrades.
